original: A list of frequently asked  SEO interview questions  and answers is given below.
result: Below is a compilation of commonly asked SEO interview questions along with their respective answers.

original: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. It is a process of increasing the number of visitors to a website. It enhances the visibility of a web page and increases the quantity and quality of traffic to a website so that it could appear at the top of search engine result pages.
result: SEO is a technique used to improve the online visibility of a website and attract more visitors to it. It involves optimizing web pages, increasing their ranking on search engine result pages and ultimately driving high-quality traffic to the website. By using SEO, website owners can increase the quantity and quality of visitors to their site, thereby increasing their online presence and ultimately achieving their business goals.

original: It optimizes the websites for search engines and thus helps it achieve higher ranking in search engine result pages when users use keywords related to their products or services. Therefore, it improves the quality as well as the quantity of traffic to a website through organic search engine results. Some of the basic activities involved in an SEO process are as follows:
result: SEO (Search Engine Optimization) is a process that involves optimizing websites for search engines, so they can achieve higher rankings in search engine results when users search for keywords related to their products or services. This leads to improved quality and quantity of traffic to a website via organic search engine results. The basic activities involved in SEO include:

original: They are called SEO executives, Webmasters, Websites optimizers, Digital marketing experts, etc.
result: Several job titles are associated with the optimization of websites and ensuring they rank high in search engines. These titles include webmasters, SEO executives, digital marketing experts, and website optimizers.

original: SEO executive: He is responsible for increasing the number of visitors or traffic to a website using various SEO tools and strategies.
result: The role of an SEO executive is to utilize a variety of SEO tools and methods to drive traffic or increase the number of visitors to a website.

original: SEO/SMO analyst : He is responsible for planning and implementing SEO and social media strategies for the clients. He is supposed to quickly understand and support initiatives to achieve the objectives and goals of the client campaigns.
result: An SEO/SMO analyst is responsible for devising and executing effective SEO and social media strategies for clients. Their primary objective is to comprehend and assist in achieving the campaign objectives and targets.

original: Webmaster : He is responsible for maintaining one or more websites. He ensures that the web servers, software, and hardware are working smoothly.
result: A webmaster is accountable for the upkeep and management of one or multiple websites. The primary responsibility of a webmaster is to keep the web servers, software, and hardware running effectively and efficiently.

original: Digital Marketing Expert : He is responsible for planning and executing digital marketing programs to promote the brand or increase the sales of the products and services of the clients.
result: The role of a digital marketing expert involves creating and implementing effective digital marketing strategies aimed at promoting a brand or achieving increased sales for clients' products and services.

original: Google webmaster tools, Google Analytics, Open site explorer, Alexa, Website grader are some of the free and basic tools which are commonly used for SEO. However, there are also many paid tools like Seo Moz, spydermate, bulkdachecker, readily available in the market.
result: There are a variety of free tools and resources available to help with search engine optimization (SEO), including Google webmaster tools, Google Analytics, Open site explorer, Alexa, and Website grader. These tools can provide valuable insights and data for optimizing a website's SEO. Alternatively, there are also numerous paid tools on the market, such as Seo Moz, spydermate, and bulkdachecker, that offer even more advanced features for those willing to invest in them.

original: Google webmaster tools : It is one of the most useful SEO tools. It is designed for the webmasters. It helps webmasters communicate with Google and evaluate and maintain their website's performance in search engine results. Using webmaster, one can identify the issues related to a website such as crawling errors, malware issues, etc. It is a free service offered by Google, anyone who has a site can use it.
result: Google's webmaster tools are a crucial set of tools for website owners and SEO professionals. It allows webmasters to communicate with Google, monitor, and improve their site's performance on search engine results pages. The tools are excellent for identifying issues that might hinder a website's performance, such as crawling errors and malware. Interestingly, anyone can use this service, as it's free and provided by Google.

original: Google analytics : It is a free Web analytics service offered by Google. It is designed to provide analytical and statistical tools for SEO and digital marketing. result: Google analytics is a completely free website analysis service provided by Google. The service equips SEO and digital marketing professionals with analytical and statistical tools. With Google analytics, you can monitor and evaluate website traffic and user behaviour. It is also accessible to anyone with a Google account.

original: Open site explorer : It is a Mozscape index-powered workhorse which is designed to research backlinks, find link-building opportunities and find out links that may impact rank badly.
result: Open site explorer is a tool that is powered by Mozscape index and is utilized for various purposes such as researching backlinks, finding opportunities for link-building and identifying links that may have a negative impact on website ranking.

original: Alexa : It is a global ranking system that compiles a list of most popular websites based on the web traffic data and accordingly provides Alexa Rank to a website. The lower the Alexa rank, the more popular a website, e.g., a site with rank 150 will have more visitors than a site with rank 160.
result: Alexa is a platform that ranks websites based on their web traffic data and assigns them an Alexa Rank. Websites with lower Alexa ranks are considered more popular, whereas sites with higher ranks are considered less popular. For instance, a website with an Alexa rank of 150 has higher traffic compared to a site with an Alexa rank of 160.

original: Website grader : It is a free online tool designed to grade a website against some critical metrics like performance, SEO, security and mobile readiness.
result: The website grader is an online tool that provides a free assessment of a website's performance, SEO, security, and mobile-readiness. It is designed to evaluate websites and provide objective feedback on their critical metrics.

result: Here are a few SEO tools that require payment:

result: Bulkdachecker is a helpful tool that allows you to check the Domain Authority of multiple websites at the same time.

original: On page SEO : It means to optimize your website and make some changes in the title, meta tags, structure, robots.txt, etc. It involves optimizing individual web pages and thus improves the ranking and attracts more relevant traffic to your site. It this type of SEO, one can optimize both the content and the HTML source code of a page.
result: Page SEO refers to the optimization of individual web pages to improve their rankings and attract relevant traffic. This involves making changes to the website's structure, meta tags, title, robots.txt, and other elements. With on-page optimization, you can improve both the content and HTML source code of your pages to achieve higher rankings in search engines.

original: Main aspects of On page SEO are:
result: The primary elements of On-page SEO comprise:

original: Body Tags (H1, H2, H3, H4, etc.)
result:
Here's my rephrased version:

Header tags, also known as H1, H2, H3, H4, etc. are HTML elements used to structure content on a webpage. They aid in organizing the text and provide a hierarchy for the content, with H1 being the most important and H6 being the least important. Header tags are essential for promoting accessibility and SEO optimization.

original: Internal Linking: You can place links to your other web pages to enhance your website. It enhances navigation and crawling.
result: One effective technique for improving your website's navigation and crawling is through the use of internal links. By incorporating links to other pages within your site, you can provide your audience with a seamless browsing experience and make it easier for search engines to crawl and index your content.

original: Off page SEO : It means optimizing your websites through backlinks, social media promotion, blog submission, press releases submission, etc.
result: Off page SEO refers to optimizing your website through various methods that occur outside of your website's content or design. These methods include strategies such as building backlinks, promoting your website through social media, submitting content to blogs, and releasing press releases. By implementing these techniques, you can improve your website's visibility and attract more traffic to your site.

original: Main aspects of Off page SEO are:
result: Off page SEO refers to the various techniques and strategies used outside of a website to improve its search engine rankings. The main focus is on building external links and establishing a strong online presence through social media, directories, and other online platforms. Off page SEO is an integral component of any comprehensive SEO strategy and can significantly impact a website's organic traffic and overall visibility.

original: In On Page SEO, optimization is done on the website that involves making changes in the title tag, meta tags, site structure, site content, solving canonicalization problem, managing robots.txt, etc. Whereas, in off page SEO, the primary focus is on building backlinks and social media promotion.
result: On Page SEO refers to the process of optimizing a website by making changes to its structure, content, meta tags, and more. This involves resolving issues related to canonicalization, managing robots.txt, and organizing site structure. In contrast, Off-Page SEO is primarily concerned with building backlinks and promoting content through social media channels.

original: On page SEO techniques:
result:
Here are some effective tactics for conducting on-page SEO:

1. Include your target keyword in the title tag, heading tags, and at least once in the body of your content.
2. Use descriptive and relevant meta descriptions and tags.
3. Optimize your URL structure to be simple, readable, and include your target keyword.
4. Make sure your website is mobile-friendly and has a fast loading speed.
5. Use internal linking to connect related pages and improve navigation.
6. Use alt tags for your images, including your target keyword when appropriate.
7. Ensure your content is high-quality, engaging, and informative.

By implementing these on-page SEO techniques, you can improve your website's ranking in search engine results pages and ultimately attract more traffic to your site.

result:
Rewritten: 

The content discusses the importance of page headers and sub-headers. These elements help to organize the content on a page and make it easier for readers to understand. By using clear and descriptive headers, users can quickly navigate to the information they need, improving their overall experience on the website. Additionally, headers can also impact SEO by providing key phrases for search engines to recognize and index. Proper use of headers and sub-headers can not only enhance the user experience but also improve the visibility and ranking of a website.

original: Internal and External Links
result:
Rewritten: 

Internal and external links connect different pages of a website to one another. Internal links direct users to other relevant pages on the same website, while external links lead users to pages on other websites. These links are important for improving website navigation, user experience, and search engine optimization.

Off-page SEO refers to the strategies and techniques used outside of a website to improve its search engine ranking. These methods focus on building links from other high-quality websites, increasing brand awareness through social media engagement, and enhancing the website's overall online reputation. By leveraging off-page SEO techniques, businesses can increase their website's visibility, drive traffic, and ultimately improve their search engine ranking.

original: It is an American multinational company which specializes in Internet-based products and services. Its services include a search engine, online advertising, cloud computing, software and more.
result: This is a multinational company based in America that offers a variety of internet-based products and services which includes online advertising, cloud computing, software, a search engine, and more.

original: It is co-founded in 1998 by Larry Page, an American computer scientist and internet entrepreneur, and Sergey Brin who is also an American computer scientist and internet entrepreneur.
result: Google was established in 1998 by two individuals, Larry Page and Sergey Brin. Larry Page is an American computer scientist and entrepreneur, while Sergey Brin is also an American computer scientist and entrepreneur.

original: A search engine is a web-based software program that is developed to search and find information on the World Wide Web. It enables internet users to search the information via the World Wide Web (WWW). The user is required to enter keywords or phrases into the search engines and then search engine searches websites, web pages or documents containing the similar keywords and presents a list of web pages with same keywords in the search engine result pages.
result: A search engine is an online software tool designed to search and locate information on the internet. It allows users to search for information on the World Wide Web by entering keywords or phrases into the search engine, which then searches for websites, web pages, or other documents with similar keywords and displays a list of matching results on the search engine results pages.

original: We can say that it generally answers the queries entered by the users in the form of a list of search results. So, it is a web-based tool that enables us to find information on the World Wide Web. Some of the popular search engines are Google, Bing, and Yahoo.
result: A search engine is a tool found online that helps users to find information by delivering a list of search results for entered queries. It is an efficient means of finding information on the internet. Popular examples of search engines include Google, Yahoo and Bing.

original: A search engine result page is the list of results for a user's search query and is displayed by the search engine. It is displayed in a browser window when the users enter their search queries in the search field on a search engine page.
result: A search engine results page is the set of outcomes that arise from a user's search query and is shown by the search engine. It appears on a browser window when users enter their search queries on a search engine webpage.

original: The list of results generally contains a list of links to web pages that are ranked from the most popular to the least popular. Furthermore, the links also contain the title and a short description of their web pages. Furthermore, SERP not only provides the list of search results, but it may also include advertisements.
result: A Search Engine Results Page (SERP) is the webpage that is displayed after a user types a term or phrase into a search engine. The page contains a list of links that are ranked based on their popularity, typically from most to least popular. The links are accompanied by a title and brief description of the webpage. In addition to organic results, the SERP may also contain paid advertisements.

original: To understand, how a search engine works, we can divide the work of search engines into three different stages: crawling, indexing, and retrieval.
result: To gain an understanding of the inner workings of search engines, we can break down their tasks into three main stages: crawling, indexing, and retrieval.

original: Crawling : It is performed by software robots called web spiders or web crawlers. Each search engine has its web spiders to perform crawling. In this step, the spiders visit websites or web pages and read them and follow the links to other web pages of the site. Thus by crawling, they can find out what is published on the World Wide Web. Once the crawler visits a page, it makes a copy of that page and adds its URL to the index.
result: Web crawling is a process carried out by software robots commonly referred to as web spiders or web crawlers. Every search engine utilizes its own web spiders to perform this task. The spiders scour websites and web pages they find, reading their content and following links to other parts of the website. This enables them to obtain information published on the World Wide Web. As soon as the crawler visits a page, it creates a copy of that page and adds its URL to the index.

original: The web spider generally starts crawling with heavily used servers and popular web pages. It follows the route determined by the link structure and finds new interconnected documents through new links. It also revisits the previous sites to check for the changes or updates in the web pages. If changes are found, it makes a copy of the changes to update the index.
result: The first step of a web spider's crawling process involves targeting frequently accessed servers and popular web pages. It then follows the links on these pages to discover new interconnected documents. The spider will also revisit previously crawled sites to check for updates or changes to the web pages. When changes are detected, the spider will make a copy of the updates to ensure the index is up-to-date.

original: Indexing : It involves building an index after crawling all websites or web pages found on the World Wide Web. An index of the crawled sites is made based on the type and quality of information provided by them and stored in huge storage facilities. It is like a book that contains a copy of each webpage crawled by the spider. Thus, it collects and organizes the information from all over the internet.
result: Indexing refers to the process of creating an index of websites or web pages on the internet after they have been crawled. The indexing process involves carefully examining the web pages or websites crawled and then cataloguing them according to the quality and type of information they provide. This index of website information is stored in large storage centers. Essentially, the index serves as a sort of book containing a copy of every webpage that has been crawled by the spider. By collecting and organizing information from across the internet, it serves as a valuable resource for users seeking information online.

original: Retrieval : In this step, the search engine responds to the search queries made by the users by providing a list of websites with relevant answers or information in a particular order. It keeps the relevant websites, which offer unique and original information, on the top of the search engine result pages. So, whenever, a user performs an online search, the search engine searches its database for the websites or web pages with relevant information and make a list of these sites based on their relevancy and present this list to the users on the search engine result pages.
result: Retrieval is a crucial step in the functioning of search engines as it involves providing a list of relevant websites and information in response to the queries made by users. To achieve this, search engines rely on their databases to locate websites or web pages that contain the requested information. The relevant sites are then ranked based on the uniqueness and originality of their content, with the highest-ranked sites appearing at the top of the search engine results pages. Therefore, when users perform an online search, the search engine retrieves answers from its database, compiles a list of relevant sites, and presents them to users according to their degree of relevancy.

original: The anchor tag is used to make click-able text written on a hyperlink, i.e., it is a clickable text in a hyperlink. It enhances the user experience as it takes the users directly to a specific area of a webpage. They are not required to scroll down the information to find a particular section. So, it is a way to improve navigation.
result: The anchor tag facilitates the creation of clickable text in a hyperlink. It serves the purpose of taking users directly to a specific section of a webpage without requiring them to manually scroll through the information. Improved navigation and user experience are among the benefits of using anchor tags.

original: It also enables webmasters to keep things in order as there is no need of creating different web pages or splitting up a document. Google also sends users to a specific part of your page using this tag. You can attach anchor tag to a word or a phrase. It takes the reader down to a different section of the page instead of another page. When you use this tag, you create a unique URL on the same page.
result: The anchor tag is an HTML feature that allows a user to navigate through pages easily. It helps webmasters maintain their websites by eliminating the need for multiple web pages or dividing a document. Additionally, Google can direct users to a particular part of a page using this tag, making it more convenient. You can link a word or phrase to an anchor tag, which will take the user to another section of the same page. This tag creates a unique URL that refers to a particular section of the same webpage.

original: A website made on flash. or
result: A website created using the Adobe Flash software.

result: An internet platform created using the latest version of HTML.
