result: There are many popular social networking sites that people use to connect and communicate with friends, family, and colleagues. Some of these include Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, Google+, Skype, Viber, Snapchat, Pinterest, and Telegram.

original: Video Sharing sites : YouTube, Vimeo, Netflix, Metacafe, Liveleak, Ustream, etc.
result: Some popular video sharing platforms include YouTube, Vimeo, Netflix, Metacafe, Liveleak, and Ustream.

original: Directory submission is an off-page SEO technique that helps improve the SEO of your site. It allows you to submit your site to a specific category of a web directory, e.g., if your website talks about heath, you are supposed to submit your site in the health category of a web directory.
result: Directory submission is an effective method used in off-page search engine optimization (SEO) to enhance the ranking of a website. It involves submitting a website to a web directory in a particular category that is related to the niche of the website. For example, if the website is about health, it needs to be submitted to the health category of a web directory.

original: You are required to follow the guidelines of a web directory before submitting your site. Some of the popular directory submission sites are www.dmoz.org and  www.seofriendly.com  and  www.directorylisting.com .
result: When submitting your website to a web directory, it is important to adhere to the directory's guidelines. Popular web directory submission sites include Dmoz.org, SEOfriendly.com, and Directorylisting.com.

original: Submitting sites to a search directory is used to get backlinks to your website. It is one of the key methods to improve the SEO of a site. The more backlinks you get, the more is the probability that the search engine will index it sooner, compared to when it is not listed. Directory submission is mostly free.
result: Directory submission is a technique used to enhance the search engine optimization (SEO) of a website by acquiring backlinks from search directories. By submitting your website to these directories, you increase the likelihood of its indexing and ranking higher in search engine results. Typically, directory submission is free of charge.

original: You can also enter a site title, which is different from the URL, containing your keywords. In this way, you can generate anchor text for your site. Furthermore, most of the search directories are ranked higher in the search engine result pages so if you submit your site to such directories, there will be more chances of your website receiving high page rank.
result: It is important to submit your website to web directories as it helps generate anchor text and more opportunities for higher search engine rankings. You can include your site's URL and a site title, which is distinct from the URL, containing your targeted keywords when submitting to directories. Additionally, these directories often have high search engine rankings, which can benefit your website's visibility.

original: Search engine submission is an off page SEO technique. In this technique, a website is directly submitted to the search engine for indexing and thus to increase its online recognition and visibility. It is an initial step to promote a website and get search engine traffic. A website can be submitted in two ways: one page at a time or the entire site at a time using a webmaster tool.
result: Search engine submission is a popular method used in off-page SEO to increase a website's online recognition and visibility. This technique involves submitting a website directly to a search engine for indexing. By doing so, it becomes easier for the website to attract search engine traffic. There are two methods for submitting a website: either submit individual pages or submit the entire site using a webmaster tool. This is a crucial first step in promoting a website online.

original: Press release submission is an off page SEO technique in which you write press releases and submit them to popular PR sites for building backlinks or to increase the online visibility of a website.
result: Press release submission is a popular off page SEO strategy that involves creating and distributing press releases to leading PR sites. This practice can help generate backlinks and improve a website's visibility online.

original: A press release generally contains information about events, new products or services of the company. It should be keyword-optimized, factual and informative so that it could engage the readers.
result: A press release typically includes details about upcoming events, recently launched products or services, or other noteworthy developments within a company. It's important for the press release to contain accurate information, incorporate relevant keywords, and be engaging for the reader.

original: Forum posting is an off page SEO technique. It involves generating quality backlinks by participating in online discussion forums of forum websites. In a forum posting, you can post a new thread as well as reply to old threads in forums to get quality backlinks to your site. Some of the popular forum websites are message boards, discussion groups, discussion forums, bulletin boards and more. So, forum websites are online discussion sites that allow you to participate in online discussion and interact with new users to promote your websites, web pages and more.
result: Forum posting is a technique used in off page SEO to create high-quality backlinks. This is done by engaging in discussions on online forums. Users can start new threads or reply to existing ones to generate links to their websites. Forum websites are also known as message boards, discussion groups, bulletin boards, etc. By participating in online discussions on these platforms, you can promote web pages and sites, as well as interact with new users.

original: RSS feed submission is an off page SEO technique. It refers to the submission of RSS feeds to RSS submission directory sites to improve the SEO of your site. RSS stands for Rich Site Summary and is also known as Really Simple Syndication.
result: RSS feed submission is a popular off-page SEO strategy utilized to enhance the online visibility of a website. It involves submitting RSS feeds to RSS submission directories, which can help improve a website's search engine optimization (SEO) rankings. Essentially, RSS is an acronym for Rich Site Summary or Really Simple Syndication.

original: An RSS feed generally contains updated web pages, videos, images, links and more. It is a format to deliver frequently changing web content. The users who find these updates interesting can subscribe your RSS feed to receive timely updates from their favorite websites. Thus, it helps increase traffic to your website.
result: An RSS feed is a tool used to distribute frequently updated content such as web pages, videos, images, and links. Users can subscribe to RSS feeds to receive updates from their favorite websites. This can increase the number of viewers that visit a website over time.

original: Guest posting is an off page SEO technique in which you publish your article or post on another person's website or blog. In other words, when you are writing a post for your blog, then your post is a simply a post, but when you write a post on someone else's blog, then your post becomes a guest post and you a guest writer. So, guest posting is a practice of contributing a post to someone else's blog to build authority and links. See the basic steps involved in guest posting:
result: Guest posting is a popular technique utilized in off page search engine optimization. It involves writing and publishing an article or blog post on a website or blog owned by someone else. Essentially, whereas a post published on your website is referred to as simply a post, the same post published on someone else's blog is known as a guest post, with you being the guest writer. The primary goal of guest posting is to avail an opportunity to build authority and acquire backlinks. Here are some basic steps involved in guest posting:

original: Google algorithm is a set of rules, codes or commands that enables Google to return search results relevant to the queries made by the users. It is the Google's algorithm that allows it to rank the websites on SERPs on the basis of quality and relevancy. The websites with quality content and relevant information tend to remain at the top of the SERPs.
result: Google algorithm refers to a series of regulations, instructions, and codes adopted by Google to provide users with appropriate search results that match their search query. These guidelines allow Google to rank websites on search engine results pages (SERPs) according to the content's quality and relevance. Websites featuring quality and relevant information are more likely to appear at the top of SERPs.

original: So, Google is a search engine that is based on a dynamic set of codes called algorithm to provide the most appropriate and relevant search results based on users' queries.
result: Google is an online search tool that applies a constantly changing set of rules referred to as algorithm to produce the most relevant search outcomes based on users' requests.

original: Google Panda is a Google algorithm update. It was primarily introduced in 2011 to reward high-quality websites and diminish the low-quality websites in SERPs. It was initially called "Farmer."
result: Google Panda is an algorithm update that was created by Google in 2011. Its primary goal is to boost the ranking of high-quality websites while diminishing the ranking of low-quality ones in search engine results pages (SERPs). Originally named "Farmer," it was designed to promote websites that provide valuable content and user experience, while penalizing those that engage in spammy, low-quality practices.

original: Panda addressed many issues in Google SERPs, such as:
result: Panda algorithm update by Google was able to resolve numerous problems that were prevalent in their search engine results pages (SERPs).

original: Low-quality user-generated content (UGC)
result: UGC that is of poor quality which has been created by users.

original: Mobilegeddon is a search engine ranking algorithm introduced by Google on 21 April 2015. It was designed to promote mobile-friendly pages in Google's mobile search results. It ranks the websites based on their mobile friendliness, i.e., the mobile-friendly sites are ranked higher than the sites that are not mobile friendly. After this algorithm update, mobile friendliness has become an important factor in ranking the websites in the SERPs.
result: On April 21, 2015, Google introduced a new search engine ranking algorithm known as Mobilegeddon. This update aimed to prioritize mobile-friendly web pages in the search engine's mobile search results. Essentially, the algorithm ranks websites based on their level of mobile-friendliness, with those that are mobile-friendly ranking higher than those that are not. As a result, mobile friendliness has become a crucial factor in how sites are ranked in search engine results pages following this update.

original: A Google penalty refers to the negative impact on the search rankings of a website. It can be automatic or manual, i.e., it may be due to an algorithm update or for using black hat SEO to improve the SEO of a site. If the penalty is manual, Google informs you about it through webmaster tool. However, if the penalty is automatic such as due to the algorithm you may not be informed. Google generally imposes the penalty in three different ways: Bans, Rank Demotion, and Temporary Rank Change.
result: A Google penalty is a detrimental effect on a website's search rankings, resulting from black hat SEO tactics or automatic algorithm updates. If the penalty is manual, the website owner is notified through webmaster tools, but automatic penalties may not be communicated. There are three types of penalties issued by Google, including bans, rank demotion, and temporary rank changes.

original: Google Sitelinks are little sub-listings that generally appear under some search results in a SERP. Google adds Sitelinks only if it thinks they are useful for the user otherwise it will not show any Sitelinks. It uses its automated algorithms to shortlist and display Sitelinks. The four links under flipkart.com, in the image given below, are known as "Sitelinks."
result: Sitelinks are additional sub-listings that usually appear below certain search results on a search engine results page (SERP). These Sitelinks are only added by Google when it thinks they will be helpful to the user. Google uses its own algorithms to determine which Sitelinks to display. In the image provided, the four links underneath flipkart.com are examples of Sitelinks.

original: HTTPS, which stands for Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure), is a protocol for secure communication on the World Wide Web. It uses SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) to add an extra layer of security to the standard HTTP connection, i.e., it is a secure version of HTTP. It encrypts all data or communication between the server and the browser.
result: HTTPS is a type of protocol that is used for secure communication on the internet. It is an improved version of the regular HTTP connection, with SSL being used to provide additional security. This encryption ensures that all communication between the browser and server is secure and confidential.

original: The websites which use HTTP protocol, the data is transmitted between the site server and the browser as plain text, so anyone who intercepts your connection can read this data. Earlier, only the websites that handle sensitive data like credit card information were using it, but now almost all sites prefer HTTPS over HTTP. An HTTPS connection provides the following benefits:
result: When websites use the HTTP protocol, data is sent between the server and the browser as plain text. This means that if someone intercepts this connection, they can read the data. In the past, only sites that dealt with sensitive information such as credit card details used HTTPS. However, nowadays, the majority of websites use HTTPS due to the added benefits it provides. An HTTPS connection has several advantages, including:

original: Hidden text is one of the oldest black hat SEO techniques to improve the ranking of a site. The hidden text, which is also known as invisible or fake text, is the content that your visitors can't see but the search engine can read or see that content.
result: The practice of hiding text on a website to improve its search engine ranking has been a long-standing black hat SEO tactic. Known as hidden, fake or invisible text, this type of content is not visible to website visitors, but can be read or detected by search engines.

original: Using hidden text to improve the ranking of a webpage is against the guidelines of search engines. The search engines can detect the hidden text in a webpage and treats it as spam and can ban your site temporarily or permanently. So it should be avoided by the SEOs.
result: It is considered a violation of search engine guidelines to use hidden text in order to boost a webpage's ranking. Such tactics can be detected by search engines and may result in your website being labeled as spam with the possibility of being temporarily or permanently banned. As such, it is recommended that SEOs abstain from using such techniques.

original: Keyword density refers to the percentage of occurrence of a keyword in a webpage out of all the words on that page. For example, if a keyword appears four times in an article of 100 words, the keyword density would be 4%. It is also known as keyword frequency as it talks about the frequency of occurrence of a keyword in a page. There is no ideal or exact keyword density for better ranking. However, the keyword density of 2 to 4 % is considered suitable for SEO.
result: Keyword density refers to the ratio of how many times a particular keyword is used on a webpage compared to the total number of words on that page. For instance, if there are four occurrences of a keyword within an article consisting of 100 words, the keyword density will be 4%. This metric is often referred to as keyword frequency, as it measures how frequently the keyword appears on a page. While there is no magic formula for achieving optimal keyword density, a ratio of 2-4% is generally considered appropriate for SEO purposes.

original: Keyword stuffing refers to increasing the keyword density beyond a certain level to achieve higher ranking in the SERPs. As we know, web crawlers analyze keywords to index the web pages, so some SEO practitioners exploit this feature of the search engine by increasing the keywords in a page. This way of improving the ranking is against the guidelines of Google, so it is considered a black hat SEO technique, and it should be avoided.
result: Keyword stuffing is when someone tries to manipulate search engine rankings by excessively repeating keywords in their website's content. This is done to make web crawlers think that the website is more relevant to the searched keywords and therefore rank it higher. However, this technique violates Google's guidelines and is classified as a black hat SEO technique. Therefore, it is not recommended to use keyword stuffing to try to improve ranking.

original: It is a black hat SEO technique to improve the SEO of a website. In this technique, the SEO practitioners rewrite a single article to produce its multiple copies in such a way that each copy is treated as a new article. These articles have low quality, repetitive content. Such articles are frequently uploaded to the site to create the illusion of fresh articles.
result: Article spinning is a method used in black hat SEO to enhance a website's search engine ranking. In this technique, practitioners rewrite one article multiple times to create new versions of it. These copies are often of poor quality and contain duplicated content. They are repeatedly uploaded to the site to give the impression of new content.

original: Doorway pages, which are also known as gateway pages, portal pages or entry pages, are created exclusively to improve ranking in the SERPs. They do not contain quality content, relevant information and have a lot of keywords and links. They are created to funnel visitors into the actual, usable or relevant portion of your site. A doorway page acts as a door between the users and your main page. Black hat SEO professionals use doorway pages to improve the ranking of a website for specific search queries or keywords.
result: Doorway pages, also called gateway pages, portal pages or entry pages, are pages created solely to enhance search engine rankings. Such pages lack quality content, relevant information and are typically loaded with keywords and links. The primary objective of doorway pages is to direct visitors towards the actual and relevant part of the website. Essentially, doorway pages serve as a virtual doorway to the main page of the website. Doorway pages are commonly used by unethical SEO experts to manipulate search rankings for specific search queries or keywords.

original: The Disavow tool is a part of Google Search Console that was introduced in October 2012. It enables you to discount the value of a backlink in order to prevent link-based penalties. It also protects the site from bad links that may harm the website's reputation.
result: The Disavow tool was added to Google Search Console in 2012 and has the ability to devalue unwanted backlinks, preventing potential penalties for links that could harm a website's reputation. Essentially, the tool helps protect websites from negative link profiles.

original: Using this tool, you can tell Google that you don't want certain links to be considered to rank websites. Some sites who buy links may suffer the penalty if they don't get these links removed using Disavow tool. The low-quality backlinks, which you don't control, may harm your site's ranking. You can ask Google not to consider them when crawling and indexing your site.
result: The Disavow tool is a feature that allows website owners to inform Google of links that should not be taken into account when ranking their site. This tool is particularly helpful for sites that have been penalized due to the presence of spammy links that they have no control over. By using the Disavow tool, website owners can disassociate themselves from such links and ensure that they do not harm their website's ranking.

original: Fetch as Google is a tool of Google available in the Google webmaster tool. It is used for immediate indexing and to find out the issues with your web pages and website. You can also use it to see how Google crawls or renders a URL on your site. Furthermore, if you found technical errors such as "404 not found" or "500 website is not available", you can simply submit your page or website for a fresh crawl using this tool.
result: The Google tool, Fetch as Google, can be accessed through the Google webmaster tool and is utilized for quick indexing and identifying problems with web pages and websites. It can also provide insight into how Google crawls and renders a site's URL. Additionally, if technical issues arise such as a "404 not found" error or the website is temporarily unavailable, one can utilize this tool by submitting their site for a fresh crawl.

original: Robot Meta tag is used to give instructions to the web spiders. It tells the search engine how to treat the content of a page. It is a piece of code which is incorporated in the "head" section of a webpage.
result: The Robot Meta tag provides instructions to web spiders about how to handle a webpage's content. It is a code that is placed in the "head" section of a webpage, and it informs search engines on how to process the content.

original: Some of the main robots Meta tag values or parameters are as follows:
result: The Meta tag is an important tool used for search engine optimization. It contains various parameters or values, such as robots, that help search engines determine how to crawl and index web pages. Some common robots Meta tag values include "index," "follow," "noindex," and "nofollow." These values indicate whether a page should be included in search engine results and whether links on the page should be followed or not.

original: The syntax of a Robots Meta tag is very simple:
result: The Robots Meta tag follows a simple syntax that is easy to understand.

original: <meta name=?robots? content=?instructions for crawler?>
result: Rewritten: The specified meta tag contains instructions for web crawlers or search engine bots on how to index a webpage.

original: In the syntax, you can add different values or parameters of robots meta tags as a placeholder as we have written: "instructions for the crawler" as a placeholder. Some commonly used values of robots meta tags include an index, follow, noindex, nofollow and more.
result: The syntax of robots meta tags allows for the inclusion of various values or parameters, such as "instructions for the crawler," which can be used as a placeholder. Common values used in robots meta tags include index, follow, noindex, nofollow, and others.

original: Google Knowledge graph refers to a block of information that appears on the right side of the SERPs after entering a search query. It is launched by Google in 2012 and is also known as Knowledge Graph Card.
result: The Google Knowledge Graph is a feature that displays relevant information on the right side of the search results page. It was introduced by Google in 2012 and is commonly referred to as a Knowledge Graph Card.

original: It provides information systematically using images, content, graphs, etc. It creates interconnected search results to makes information more appealing, accurate, structured and relevant. So, it is an enhancement of the organic Google search results as it understands the facts about, people, places, objects, etc.
result: Visual search is a search result enhancement that presents information in a structured manner using images, content and graphs. Unlike organic Google search results, it creates interconnected search results that provide accurate and relevant information about various subjects such as people, places, and objects. Visual search improves Google search results by comprehending factual information and presenting it in a more appealing and structured manner.

original: Google Sandbox is an imaginary area which contains new and less authoritative sites for a specified period until they cannot be displayed in the search results. It is an alleged filter for the new websites. In simple words, we can say that it places new websites on probation and ranks them lower than expected in searches. It may be caused by building too many links within a short period of time.
result: The Google Sandbox is a concept that refers to a virtual space supposedly containing newly created or less well-established websites for a certain period of time, during which they may not rank as highly as desired in search results. This is thought to be a form of filter for new websites and can be triggered by creating too many backlinks too quickly.

original: Any type of website can be placed in a sandbox. However, the new websites who want to rank for highly competitive keyword phrases are more prone to the sandbox. There is no fixed duration for a site to stay in the sandbox. Generally, a website can stay in the Sandbox for one to six months. The logic behind the sandbox is that new websites may be not as relevant as older sites.
result: Websites of any type are susceptible to being placed in a sandbox, but those that are new and seeking to rank for highly competitive keywords are particularly vulnerable. While there is no set timeframe for this, it is not uncommon for a website to remain in the sandbox for anywhere from one to six months. The rationale behind this practice is that newer websites may not be as pertinent as older, established sites.

result: AMP is a free and open source initiative that focuses on making web pages load faster on mobile devices. Publishers can utilize AMP to enhance the mobile user experience by improving the readability and speed of their content. The project was developed through a collaboration among various companies, including Google, Adobe, and WordPress.

result:
Sure, I can help you with that. Here's one possible rephrased version:

"Let me assist you in creating the schema markup code. This code will be embedded in your website's HTML to help search engines understand the content and structure of your website better. It's a crucial SEO component that can improve your website's rankings and visibility in search results. By implementing schema markup code, you'll provide search engines with contextual information about your website, such as the type of content, business type, address, phone numbers, and other relevant details. This information can be displayed in rich snippets, which allow users to quickly see what your website is about and whether it meets their needs."

original: Schema markup, which is also known as structured data, is a code or microdata that you incorporate in your web pages to enable search engine better understand your pages and provide more relevant results to users. It helps search engines interpret and categorize information, which you want to highlight and to be presented as a rich snippet by the search engine.
result: Schema markup, also referred to as structured data, is an integration of code or microdata into web pages with the aim of improving search engine comprehension and relevance of results to users. It assists search engines in interpreting and organizing data that website owners want to emphasize and showcase as a rich snippet in search results.

original: The schema does not affect the crawling. It just changes the way the information is displayed and assigns a meaning to the content. So, it tells the search engine what your data means rather than just telling what it says.
result: The use of a schema does not impact the process of crawling for search engines. However, it does alter the way in which information is presented and assigns a specific interpretation to the content. Essentially, it communicates to the search engine the meaning behind the data, as opposed to simply stating what it says.

original: CTR stands for Click through Rate. It is calculated by dividing the number of times a link appears on a search engine result page (impression) by the number of times it is clicked by users. For example, if you have 10 clicks and 100 impressions, your CTR would be 10%.
result: CTR is an acronym that stands for Click Through Rate. It measures the effectiveness of a search engine result page by determining how often users click on a particular link. The calculation involves dividing the number of clicks by the number of impressions, which is the number of times the link has appeared in search results. To illustrate, if a link has 100 impressions and 10 clicks, it has a CTR of 10%.

original: The higher the clicks, the higher will be the CTR. A high click-through rate is essential for a successful PPC, i.e., the success of a PPC depends on the CTR. Thus, it is an important metric in PPC ads which helps you gauge the results and tells how effective your campaigns are.
result: The success of a pay-per-click (PPC) campaign depends on its click-through rate (CTR). A higher CTR indicates a higher number of clicks on your ad, making it an essential metric to gauge the effectiveness of your campaigns. Therefore, it's crucial to maintain a high CTR to ensure successful PPC advertising.

original: PPC stands for pay-per-click. It is a type of search engine marketing in which you have to pay a fee each time your advertisement is clicked by an online user. Search engines like Google, Bing, etc., offer pay-per-click advertising on auction basis where the highest bidder gets the most prominent advertising space on the SERPs so that it gets a maximum number of clicks.
result: PPC, which is short for pay-per-click, refers to a form of search engine marketing where advertisers pay a fee each time their ads are clicked by online users. Major search engines like Google and Bing display paid ads on a bidding system, with the highest bidder receiving the most prominent ad space on the search engine results pages. This can lead to increased clicks and website traffic for advertisers.

original: Bounce rate refers to the percentage of single-page visits in which the visitor views only one page of your website and then leaves the website from the landing page without browsing other pages. In simple words, it is the single-page sessions divided by all sessions. Google analytics tells the bounce rate of a web page or a website.
result: Bounce rate is a metric that indicates the proportion of visitors who exit a website after viewing a single page without exploring other pages. Essentially, it is the number of one-page sessions divided by total sessions. Bounce rate can be determined through Google Analytics and is an important tool for evaluating website user engagement.

original: Bounce rate tells you how users are finding your site, e.g., if the bounce rate is too high, it indicates your site does not contain the relevant information, or the information is not useful for the visitors.
result: Bounce rate is a metric used to evaluate how effective your website is in engaging visitors. If the bounce rate is high, it may suggest that visitors are finding your site irrelevant or that it lacks value to them.

original: Alexa.com is a website and a subsidiary company of Amazon.com that provides a wide range of services out of which one is Alexa rank. This rank is a metric that ranks websites in a particular order on the basis of their popularity and website traffic in the last three months.
result: Alexa.com is an online service that offers various tools and features for website owners. One such tool is the Alexa rank, which measures the popularity and traffic of a website over the past three months and assigns it a numeric ranking. Alexa.com is owned by Amazon.com and is widely used to determine a website's performance and traffic compared to other sites on the internet.

original: Alexa generally considers the unique daily visitors and average page views over a period of 3 months to calculate the Alexa rank for a website. Alexa rank is updated daily. The lower the Alexa rank, the more popular a site will be. An increase or decrease in the rank shows how your SEO campaigns are doing.
result: Alexa rank is calculated by taking into account the average number of page views and unique visitors a website receives over a period of three months. It is updated daily and is an indicator of a website's popularity. A lower rank implies greater popularity. An increase or decrease in the rank is indicative of the success or failure of SEO efforts.

original: RankBrain is Google's machine-learning artificial intelligence system designed to help Google to process search results and deliver more relevant information to users. It is a part of the Google's Hummingbird search algorithm. It can learn and recognize new patterns and then revisit SERPs to provide more relevant information.
result: RankBrain is an innovative system by Google that employs machine learning techniques to enhance the search experience for users. It works within Google's Hummingbird search algorithm to analyze search queries and deliver more personalized and valuable search results. By continuously learning and adapting to new patterns, RankBrain is able to provide users with increasingly relevant information.

original: It has the ability to embed the written language into mathematical entities called vectors that Google can understand. For example, if it does not understand a sentence, it can guess its meaning with similar words or sentences and filter the information accordingly to provide accurate and relevant results to users.
result: Google's search engine uses a technique called word embedding to convert the language in written content into mathematical vectors, enabling it to understand the content. When it encounters an unfamiliar sentence, it can use similar words and sentences to infer its meaning and accurately filter the information to provide relevant search results.

original: The referral traffic refers to the visitors that come to your site from the direct links on other websites rather than from the search engine. In simple words, the visits to your domain directly from other domains are called referral traffic. For example, a site that likes your page may post a link recommending your page. The visitor on this site may click on this link and visit your site.
result: Referral traffic is the term used to describe visitors that land on your website by clicking a link on another website. This type of traffic does not come from search engines but rather through direct links on other domains. For instance, if a website likes your content, they can provide a link to your website and encourage their visitors to check it out. If a user clicks on this link, they will be directed to your website, and this is referred to as referral traffic.

original: You can also increase referral traffic by leaving links on other blogs, forums, etc. when you put a hyperlink of your page on other websites like forums users will click and visit your webpage. Google tracks such visits as referral visits or traffic. So, it is a Google's way of reporting visits that come to your site from sources outside of search engine.
result: One way to drive more traffic to your website is by increasing the number of referrals. Referral traffic refers to the visitors that come to your site through external sources, such as links on other blogs or forums. By leaving links to your website on other platforms, you can encourage users to click through to your site and increase your referral traffic. These visits are important to Google as they indicate that your site is being accessed from sources outside of search engines. By boosting your referral traffic, you can increase your chances of attracting new visitors to your site.

original: Keyword stemming is the process of finding the root word of a search query and then creating new keywords by adding prefixes, suffixes and pluralizing the root word. For example, a query "Searcher" can be broken down to the word "search" and then more words can be created by adding prefixes, suffixes or pluralizing this root word, such as research, searcher, searchers, searching, searchable, etc.
result: Keyword stemming is a method of identifying the root form of a search term and generating additional keywords by adding prefixes, suffixes and plurals to the root word. For instance, the query "Searcher" can be deconstructed into the root word "search" and expanded into variations such as research, searcher, searchers, searching, searchable, and more.

original: Similarly, you can add the prefix "en" to "large" to make it "enlarge" and add a suffix "ful" to "power" to make it "powerful." This practice allows you to expand your keyword list and thus helps get more traffic.
result: Expanding your keyword list can lead to more traffic to your website. One way to do this is by adding prefixes and suffixes to existing keywords, such as adding "en" to "large" to make "enlarge" or adding "ful" to "power" to make "powerful." This technique allows you to generate more variations of keywords to target and boost your website's search engine rankings.

original: LSI stands for Latent Semantic Indexing. It is a part of the Google's algorithm which enables the search engine to understand the content of a page and the intent of the search queries. It identifies related words in content to better classify web pages and thus to deliver more relevant and accurate search results. It can understand synonyms and the relationship between words and thus can interpret web pages more deeply to provide relevant information to users. For example, if someone searches with a keyword "CAR," it will show related things such as car models, car auctions, car race, car companies and more. See the image:
result: LSI refers to Latent Semantic Indexing, which is a component of the Google algorithm. It enhances the search engine's ability to comprehend the content of a webpage and the intent of search queries. This is achieved via the identification of related terms within the content, which aids in the accurate classification of web pages, ultimately resulting in more relevant search results. LSI has the capacity to recognise the connection between words, understand synonyms and more deeply interpret web pages to facilitate the provision of relevant information to users.
